subject: Pedal Return - Order #SSN3597
description_text:
Hello,

I recently purchased the Plus X pedals, and they have been very rough to
use. They constantly disconnect from my PC, and certain games don't even
pick up the signals. I have tried using the Simsonn manager and even
freejoy but both don't fix the Issue. I would like to refund the pedals
please. Let me know what the next steps are to make the return.

Order number is #SSN3597

Thank you.

conversations.body_text: Hi Abdullah Khokhar,    There may be two possible issues:    Please use the USB 3.0 port on the back of your PC and avoid using USB hubs.    There may be a grounding issue.    If this problem occurs, it indicates that your PC might not be properly grounded—for example, the power plug may not be connected to a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the PC case to the pedal frame, and also connect the main control box to the metal screws of the pedals. This will effectively resolve the disconnection issue.     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hello,

I did attempt those two. It was straight plugged into a USB 3.0 and also my
PC is well grounded. I even used the ground cable included in the pedals
and grounded them. No difference. Games only pick up the pedals after 50%
presses even though it’s calibrated in the app (this is if it even works in
the first place)

On Wed, Nov 26, 2025 at 04:00 service @simsonn.com

Hi Abdullah Khokhar,  If this is the case, it means the pedal’s mechanical structure has been adjusted. Please click Offset in the software to reset the pedal signal to zero; the white signal will then start from 0%. After recalibrating the pedal, the blue signal will correctly range from 0% to 100%.

On the software it shows proper calibration but in game it doesn’t register
until 50%

On Wed, Nov 26, 2025 at 04:35 service @simsonn.com

Hi Abdullah Khokhar,     If the software calibration is correct, pressing each pedal should make the blue progress bar go from 0% to 100%, indicating that the pedals are functioning normally. You only need to reopen the game and rebind the pedals in the game settings.  For iRacing or F1 games, additional in-game calibration may be required. Here is a reference link for F1 2025 to guide you.     https://www.reddit.com/r/simracing/comments/1nj93bq/simsonn_plus_x_pedals_setup_guide_in_f1_25/

Hi

On Wed, Nov 26, 2025 at 04:56 service @simsonn.com

Hi Abdullah Khokhar,    Hello, here is the setup guide for using the SIMSONN Plus X pedals in F1 25:    First time entering the game    You may see a message:   NO PRESET CONTROL SCHEME FOR DEVICE(S) SIMSONN Plus X Please customise your controls in the Settings Menu...     Click Okay to continue.      Bind controls and save a new scheme    Go to Settings → Controls to bind pedals and buttons.    When exiting, select Save as new Control Scheme, give it a name (e.g., SIMSONN), and click Save.      Manage and switch control schemes    Main Menu → Settings → Controls → Control Scheme List    Your SIMSONN scheme will appear; you can select it directly for future use.       ? Note: If you delete the scheme without backup, you will need to repeat the binding and saving process.     After completing these steps, your pedals will work properly in the game, providing a realistic driving experience.
